Alt Carbon, a climate tech startup, has raised $12 million in seed funding to scale its innovative carbon removal efforts in India through enhanced rock weathering. By utilizing waste basalt rock dust to remove carbon dioxide while improving soil fertility and crop yields, Alt Carbon aims to remove 5 million tons of carbon from 500,000 hectares of farmland by 2030. With partnerships including Stripe, Mitsubishi, and BCG, and a carbon credit cost estimated at $270 per metric ton—lower than alternatives—the company is positioned to deliver scalable and cost-effective climate solutions.

This matters to business leaders because Alt Carbon’s approach addresses both environmental sustainability and economic challenges, creating opportunities within carbon markets. Its innovative model provides a pathway for organizations seeking verifiable, high-impact carbon offsets while supporting agricultural productivity.
